content.question:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

A random sample of <math alttext="65"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> high school seniors was selected from all high school seniors at a certain high school. The following scatterplot shows the height, in centimeters <math alttext="c m"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the foot length, in <math alttext="centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for each high school senior from the sample. The least-squares regression line is shown. The computer output from the least-squares regression analysis is also shown.

Term
 <math alttext="coefficient"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="S E"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> <math alttext="coefficient"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="T"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-Value
 <math alttext="P"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-Value

Constant
 <math alttext="105.08"><mstyle><mrow><mn>105.08</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="6.00"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="17.51"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17.51</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Foot length
 <math alttext="2.599"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.599</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.238"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.238</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="10.92"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.92</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals, 5.90181"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5.90181</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="R squared equals 65.42 percent"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">–</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>65.42</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate and interpret the residual for the high school senior with a foot length of <math alttext="20 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a height of <math alttext="160 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text:
Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations.

A random sample of <math alttext="65"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> high school seniors was selected from all high school seniors at a certain high school. The following scatterplot shows the height, in centimeters <math alttext="c m"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the foot length, in <math alttext="centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, for each high school senior from the sample. The least-squares regression line is shown. The computer output from the least-squares regression analysis is also shown.

Term
 <math alttext="coefficient"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="S E"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> <math alttext="coefficient"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">o</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="T"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-Value
 <math alttext="P"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>P</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-Value

Constant
 <math alttext="105.08"><mstyle><mrow><mn>105.08</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="6.00"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.00</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="17.51"><mstyle><mrow><mn>17.51</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Foot length
 <math alttext="2.599"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.599</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.238"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.238</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="10.92"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10.92</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="0.000"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.000</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="S equals, 5.90181"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">S</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5.90181</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="R squared equals 65.42 percent"><mstyle><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">R</mi><mo lspace="0em" rspace="0em">–</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>65.42</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate and interpret the residual for the high school senior with a foot length of <math alttext="20 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and a height of <math alttext="160 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>160</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>.
(b) The standard deviation of the residuals is <math alttext="s equals 5.9"><mstyle><mrow><mi>s</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5.9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Interpret the value in context.

(c) The following histogram summarizes the <math alttext="65"><mstyle><mrow><mn>65</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> residuals.

Assume that the distribution of residuals is approximately normal with mean <math alttext="0 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and standard deviation <math alttext="5.9 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.9</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>. What percent of the residuals are greater than <math alttext="8 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your answer.

(d) Based on your answer to part (c), would it be surprising to randomly select a high school senior from the high school with a foot length of <math alttext="20 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> and a height greater than <math alttext="165 centimeters"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>165</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">c</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>? Justify your answer.

topic.text: 1.7: Summary Statistics for a Quantitative Variable

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Calculate summary statistics, relative positions of points within a distribution, correlation, and predicted response.
